title: Liverpool vs Newcastle predicted line-ups: Team news and more for Premier League clash
text:
Liverpool welcome Newcastle United to Anfield on Saturday as the Premier League returns after the international break.

Jurgen Klopp’s side have won their first four games and are top of the Premier League table.

Newcastle will travel to Merseyside seeking a first win at Liverpool in 25 years, but will be without midfielder Sean Longstaff, who turned an ankle in training.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

Steve Bruce’s side have already won away at one of the top six this season, beating Tottenham, and drew with Watford last time out.

Naby Keita is close to being fit again and could be in consideration for the hosts, but Liverpool remain without goalkeeper Alisson.

Shape Created with Sketch. Premier League team news September 14-15 Show all 6 left Created with Sketch. right Created with Sketch. Shape Created with Sketch. Premier League team news September 14-15 1/6 Arsenal probable XI 2/6 Spurs probable XI 3/6 Liverpool probable XI 4/6 Man City probable XI 5/6 Chelsea probable XI 6/6 Man United probable XI 1/6 Arsenal probable XI 2/6 Spurs probable XI 3/6 Liverpool probable XI 4/6 Man City probable XI 5/6 Chelsea probable XI 6/6 Man United probable XI

Predicted line-ups

Liverpool: Adrian; Alexander-Arnold, Matip, van Dijk, Robertson; Henderson, Fabinho, Wijnaldum; Salah, Firmino, Mane

Newcastle: Dubravka; Krafth, Schar, Lascelles, Dummett, Willems; Almiron, Hayden, Ki Sung-yeung, Atsu; Joelinton

Match prediction?

While Tottenham failed to unlock a well-built Newcastle defence, Liverpool should have too much quality and creativity for Steve Bruce’s side.

A 3-0 home win is our prediction.

Odds

Liverpool 2/13

Newcastle 20/1

Draw 8/1

How can I watch it?

BT Sport will be broadcasting the game on BT Sport 1, with coverage beginning at 12pm.

Can I stream the game online?

With a BT Sport subscription you can stream the match from your phone or tablet with the BT Sport app.

When is it?

The match is Saturday’s early Premier League kick-off

It gets underway at 12.30pm.

Jurgen Klopp’s side have won their first four games and are top of the Premier League table. Newcastle will travel to Merseyside seeking a first win at Liverpool in 25 years, but will be without midfielder Sean Longstaff, who turned an ankle in training.
